alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 22 at 2:21AM MST until March 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST /6 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of rain will continue early this morning, with snow levels around 8000 feet. Snow levels will fall quickly from west to east through the early morning hours, likely turning to snow in the Flagstaff area around sunrise. Periods of snow will continue through the morning, becoming more showery during the afternoon. Expect snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches above 6500 feet, with 10 to 16 inches above 8500 feet. Southwest winds gusting as high as 55 mph early, slowly decreasing through the day. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff and Williams. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible toward daybreak on Wednesday.Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Additional snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 5 PM Today: Doney Park 2 to 4 inches Flagstaff 4 to 6 inches Williams 2 to 4 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
